New Records: The Chicago White Sox set a new franchise record for losses in a season with 107.
Key Match Events: Garrett Crochet struck out the first seven hitters he faced.
Post-Match Reflections: White Sox postgame show host Chuck Garfien expressed frustration, saying, 'We’re on this set to talk about winning games and I’ve only done it 31 times this year.'
Ozzie Guillen, former manager, commented on the team's poor performance, saying, 'At the end of the day, this is embarrassing.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sunday’s loss capped off a 0-10 homestand, another first in franchise history.
The White Sox are the first team to have three losing streaks of 10 or more games in a season since the 1965 Mets.
